reviews.review_msg: One of the best prof's I had at SFU. Sad to see he only taught for a couple years at SFU. Inspirational teacher, tough marker who expected a lot from his students. I wish I had a chance to take another course with him. Brought Geography alive.
Great professor, very clear, very interesting lectures, and will always offer help. Attendance is mandatory, and exams are a bit much, but if they is a class with Akin, then take it.

Unbelievably passionate about geography !!! I've never met a prof so in love with geography and educating his students :)! The guy literally stays up at night wondering how he can further help struggling students in his class. Work hard and he recognizes it. A+++!
Excellent Pro. Interesting Class. 100% worth your tuition! :)

Shes nice and passionate on the topic but disorganized, many slides/readings not uploaded, a couple of classes were cancelled, and brief and unclear descriptions for assignments, which were graded quite tough. The lectures were short and didnt learn much from them

Dont take this class if shes the prof, her teaching is super disorganized so even if the content is interesting youre getting nothing from it. Her assignments are very vague and the expectations are super high so dont expect to get a good mark if you dont do way more than expected. This class was probably way better with the original prof.
I highly recommend avoiding her. her classes are unclear, the material is basically just pro-marxism, it's tiresome, she denies reality, really avoid if you can.

Tons of readings for a second year course. Lots of assignments, but at least it ensures that you will do well if you have one bad mark. Lectures got better after the 'guest' lectures. TA Jonathan extremely helpful and knowledgable for PolSci guy.

Eugene is one of my favourite professors I have had at SFU. He explains things so well during lecture and I found all of his assignments actually enjoyable to do. He really does care about his students and Is passionate about what he teaches. I would take all my classes with Eugene if I could.

Very cool Scottish guy. You really do work for your grade in his class, but attending lectures really helps. His enthusiasm is inspiring and it helped grow my interest in the subject material, especially since he uses examples from the Metro Vancouver area.

If you have the opportunity to take one of his classes, do it!

Eugene is a cool dude who is compassionate about the topics he teaches. He's very caring, and provides clear criteria and feedback for assignments. Reading the textbook is very important for assessments in this course. Participation in lectures isn't mandatory, but tutorials are graded by participation. Would recommend!

Eugene is one of the best professors I have had at SFU thus far. His teaching methods are thorough and easy to follow. His interests and research areas shine through in his presentations and geographic analysis' of Vancouver. This being said, he is a fairly hard marker. I didn't find it too difficult because he made me want to push myself to learn.

The work you put in this course is what you get out! There is a lot of work, but if you attend lectures, take good notes, and do all the assigned readings you will get a satisfying mark! Eugene is very passionate in what he teaches, which makes learning from him a wonderful experience! You'll leave the class as a "critical urban geographer."

Go to the lecture and take good notes. The study guide for the midterm and final exam are extremely useful and are almost identical to what to expect. Just try to memorize all the class notesstudy from the study guide and you'll do good in this class.

great prof. seems to start out the class a little slow and is a little unorganized. pay extreme attention to lectures. no need to read the Hall textbook. funny relaxed type of guy that brings some very relavent and interesting ideas to the table

The handout he gives you b/f the midterm and final helps immensley. As for the papers the TA was responsible for those. With 20 minutes to go in the last tutorial she complains they were all poorly done. She then promptly hands them out and leaves the room.. With 20 minutes left! The second paper is killer because it is near impossible to relate to

Not a very good prof. Not knowledgeable about Canada. Expects us to mindlessly regurgitate course material on essays without having our own opinions. 2 essays each worth 10% and lots of funny rules about how to write that don't make sense. Essays only 5 pages but min. 7 sources but don't stray fromt the message given in lecture--impossible! Avoid!
Very interesting lectures. The study guides that he gives really help with studying. But a lot of us were in for a shock for the mid term. His marking ranges from fair to hard.
This prof seems like a good guy and his lectures are alright but his marking is unfair.  Always refers to America in examples and has a messed up marking scheme.  I wouldnt recommend him.
Great prof! Great class! Great guy!

Loved the class. Actually wanted to go to the lectures because they were so interesting! Awesome teaching methods, never a dull moment! A very approachable and fair teacher! Two thumbs up!!  I would love to take another class with him!
awesome prof
